result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of SEH on 12/16/15 - Tina B

Mr Randtke to review PSI
Sentencing: 12-16-15 at 3:15 w/TWB
From: Law Clerk To: Def Re: TWB cannot read ltr, need to go through counsel and copy would need to be sent to DA
From: Def Re: one more chance to get into Drug Court

3:38 pm Def in court w/ Atty S. Joseph Randtke.  Def in custody.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Randtke:  I don't think he was intentionally non-compliant with probation.  He made all of his appointments...  He was also in custody for 3 weeks and they didn't meet with him.  He went to see his agent and they wouldn't see him and didn't give him a new date.  After multiple attempts, I finally got a hold of his agent.  He was assigned a new agent.  He's always kept in contact and been in town....   I don't think the PSI is a fair characterizaton of him.  He's in jail and in constant pain.  We're requesting that he get to the hospital.  I know he's got new cases.  He's asking to have his bond reinstated.  He's never been a flight risk.  Soto-Guzman comments.  Hynek:  He's had so many chances this year and has messed.  He's only concerned with his pain and daughter when he's in front of you...  These charges have been pending since the first of this year.  He continues to pick up charges.  The cash bonds are appropriate.  Nothing should be modified at this time.
COURT is aware that the issues with probation and parole are problematic.   Multiple open files.  Minimun high risk.  I think that what I did was correct as well.  If you want to get the sentencing moved up, Mr. Randtke, you can.  Bonds to remain.

3:45 pm No appearance by Def - Atty S. Joseph Randtke present.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Randtke states his client is in Rochester right now.  He contacted me about 8 times today saying his ride fell through but he got another ride.  He can't get here before the close of business today.
CC tomorrow at 1:30 pm.  He's also to see his PO to get an appointment for an updated PSI.  All of the info is not in there.

State by Anderson & Vasupuram /  Def in custody w/Atty Randtke
CRT:  Bond to remain as set

Def w/Atty Randtke
CRT:DRI w/15CF2

11:18 am - Def in court w/Atty S. Joseph Randtke.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds   Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  NG Pleas entered.
